dr.evomodel.tree
Class HiddenLinkageModel

java.lang.Object
  dr.inference.model.AbstractModel
      dr.evomodel.treelikelihood.TipStatesModel
          dr.evomodel.tree.HiddenLinkageModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
PatternList, TaxonList, Model, ModelListener, StatisticList, VariableListener, MPISerializable, Identifiable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<Taxon>
public class HiddenLinkageModel
extends TipStatesModel
implements PatternList

A model of linkage among sets of metagenome sequence reads Reads are assumed to derive from a fixed number of organisms, where the identity of the organisms is unknown, and the assignment of reads to those organisms is also unknown.

Author:
Aaron Darling (koadman)
See Also:
Serialized Form

acceptState

protected void acceptState()
Description copied from class: TipStatesModel
This call specifies that the current state is accept. Most models will not need to do anything. Sub-models are handled automatically and do not need to be considered in this method.

Overrides:
acceptState in class TipStatesModel

handleModelChangedEvent

protected void handleModelChangedEvent(Model model,
                                       java.lang.Object object,
                                       int index)
Overrides:
handleModelChangedEvent in class TipStatesModel

handleVariableChangedEvent

protected void handleVariableChangedEvent(Variable variable,
                                          int index,
                                          Variable.ChangeType type)
Description copied from class: TipStatesModel
This method is called whenever a parameter is changed.

It is strongly recommended that the model component sets a "dirty" flag and does no further calculations. Recalculation is typically done when the model component is asked for some information that requires them. This mechanism is 'lazy' so that this method can be safely called multiple times with minimal computational cost.

Overrides:
handleVariableChangedEvent in class TipStatesModel

restoreState

protected void restoreState()
Description copied from class: TipStatesModel
After this call the model is guaranteed to have returned its extra state information to the values coinciding with the last storeState call. Sub-models are handled automatically and do not need to be considered in this method.

Overrides:
restoreState in class TipStatesModel

storeState

protected void storeState()
Description copied from class: TipStatesModel
Additional state information, outside of the sub-model is stored by this call.
